entry.title: Grayscale Bitcoin Shares Discount Hits Lowest Since Last Summer
entry.summary: The GBTC discount narrowed amid renewed hopes of an ETF approval in the U.S. or the beginning of redemptions for Bitcoin.

entry.title: Bankrupt Celsius Demands StakeHound Return $150M in Ethereum, Polygon and Polkadot
entry.summary: Large quantities of the bankrupt crypto lender Celsius' Ethereum were locked up with the staking platform.

entry.title: South Korea to Mandate Firms Issue Crypto Disclosures in Financial Statements
entry.summary: The country's financial regulator has slated the new crypto guidelines, which mandate a range of new information for disclosure, for January.

entry.title: Free Slurpee NFTs Served Up by 7-Eleven
entry.summary: The ‘Find Your Slurpee Vibe’ Polygon collectible represents the latest snack food brand to enter Web3.

entry.title: Arkham CEO Defends ‘Dox-to-Earn’ Program, Says Identifying Bad Actors Is 'The Whole Point'
entry.summary: “Arkham focuses on strictly publicly available information to then draw connections about what entities own what wallets,” said Miguel Morel.

entry.title: 'Gran Saga: Unlimited' Is a Promising MMORPG Launching on Aptos
entry.summary: PREVIEW: Gran Saga: Unlimited is an open-world anime game that lets players fight creatures using guns, melee weapons, and magic.

entry.title: Claude 2 Is Out—How Does Anthropic’s AI Chatbot Compare to ChatGPT and Google Bard?
entry.summary: Anthropic's latest entry can handle 100k of context, but will it be enough to compete?

entry.title: Gran Saga Unlimited Early Access: Inside the Anime MMORPG on Aptos
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin plays Gran Saga: Unlimited's second community playtest, reports her findings, and offer her opinion and insights on the upcoming game, which will offer optional Aptos NFTs.

entry.title: Bitcoin Has Formed a 'Firm Foundation' Under $30000: Glassnode
entry.summary: History suggests that Bitcoin may be due for many months of sideways trading, the firm said.

entry.title: The Latest NFT Trend: Taking Out Loans on Rolexes
entry.summary: NFT lending protocol Arcade and escrow service 4K aim to create a global pawn shop of strangers, starting with Rolex and Patek Philippe watches.

entry.title: Is Binance Too Big to Fail?
entry.summary: The crypto industry has withstood what were supposed to be fatal blows before. Would Binance leave a permanent dent if it crumbles?

entry.title: Another $103M Disappears From Multichain in Potential ‘Rug Pull’
entry.summary: The hack of the former Anyswap platform is flagged as an inside job by Chainalysis.

entry.title: FTX Exec Investigated for Illegal Donations to Girlfriend's Congressional Campaign: WSJ
entry.summary: The FBI raided the home of Ryan Salame in April while investigating Sam Bankman-Fried’s political activities.

entry.title: Feds Charge Engineer in First-Ever Decentralized Exchange Hack Case
entry.summary: U.S. Attorney Damian Williams today said that Shakeeb Ahmed "used his expertise to defraud" and allegedly steal $9 million in crypto.

entry.title: UK to Exclude 'Unbacked’ Cryptocurrencies From Digital Securities Sandbox Initiative
entry.summary: The British government does not plan to modify the existing legislative framework for derivatives and unbacked cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin.

entry.title: What Are Play-to-Earn (P2E) Games?
entry.summary: Unlike in regular games, where in-game items are held on walled-off data networks and owned by the companies that created the game, NFTs enable players to own the unique assets that they purchase.

entry.title: DeFi Project Rodeo Finance Hacked for $888,000 in Ethereum
entry.summary: An exploiter was able to run away with roughly $888,000 in Ethereum from Rodeo’s interest-bearing USDC pool.

entry.title: You Can Now Earn Bitcoin for Playing Minecraft—Here’s How
entry.summary: The Satlantis Minecraft server is now giving out over 1 million satoshis per week in partnership with Bitcoin payments startup Zebedee.

entry.title: Magic Johnson-Backed SimWin Sports Infuses Fantasy Football With AI and NFTs
entry.summary: The platform aims to bridge eSports and fantasy sports with a 24/7 virtual football league.

entry.title: NFT-Powered Dan Harmon Series 'Krapopolis' Finally Gets Premiere Date
entry.summary: An NFT collection affiliated with Harmon’s new animated series on Fox has already generated almost $1 million in sales.

entry.title: MATIC Soars 9% Ahead of Polygon 2.0 Rollout, Rebounding Network Growth
entry.summary: Polygon’s uptick can likely be attributed to rebounding on-chain growth and the completion of a $66 million sell-off by bankrupt Celsius.

entry.title: Paradigm Files Amicus Brief in SEC’s Lawsuit Against Bittrex
entry.summary: The SEC lacks the authority to regulate secondary markets for crypto assets, argues crypto investment firm Paradigm.

entry.title: You Can Now Store Your Bitcoin Private Key as Colors
entry.summary: A new tool for backing up your private keys could make it even harder for thieves—and the government—to seize your coins.

entry.title: Grayscale Cries Foul Over SEC Approval of a Different Kind of Bitcoin ETF
entry.summary: The company says the difference between a leveraged Bitcoin future ETF and a spot Bitcoin ETF isn’t enough to stonewall the latter.

entry.title: Netflix Taps AI To Push Visual Effects Beyond the Green Screen
entry.summary: Why go for a green screen when there’s an AI-powered magenta option?

entry.title: Fei Protocol Discord Was Not 'Seized' Amid Class-Action Lawsuit, Says Lawyer
entry.summary: A message appearing on Fei Labs' Discord alerted investors who may have been hurt by its shaky launch event in April 2021 on how to file a notice for compensation as part of an ongoing class-action lawsuit against the platform.

entry.title: Daily Ordinals Inscriptions Approach All-Time High as Bitcoin Fees Remain Low
entry.summary: The Ordinals ecosystem has seen a flood of new projects, and fees have remained low.

entry.title: 'The Machines Arena' Adds In-Game Rewards That Can Be Minted as NFTs (Eventually)
entry.summary: Players with lots of XP in The Machines Arena will be able to unlock character skins that can later be minted and traded.

entry.title: Scientists Use AI to Discover Drugs That Kill 'Zombie Cells', Fight Age-Related Diseases
entry.summary: A group of researchers used AI to do in five minutes what could have taken weeks: Discovering new drugs that can kill senescent cells.

entry.title: ApeCoin Crashes to All-Time Low as Bored Ape Yacht Club NFT Prices Sink
entry.summary: The Ethereum token linked to Yuga Labs' Bored Ape Yacht Club collection has now fallen nearly 93% from its peak price.

entry.title: Bitcoin Will Reach $120K Before 2025, Standard Chartered Predicts
entry.summary: The British bank believes miners will soon begin hoarding their coins and choking off available market supply.

entry.title: Former SEC Chair Says Bitcoin ETF Could Be Approved—If These Conditions Are Met
entry.summary: The former SEC chair said that a Bitcoin ETF will be approved in the States if an applicant can prove it's an efficient way for investors to buy BTC.

entry.title: Staked Ethereum Now Accounts for 20% of the Total Supply
entry.summary: The amount of Ethereum pledged to secure the network has grown significantly since withdrawals were enabled in April.

entry.title: Vanguard Now Owns $560 Million Worth of Bitcoin Mining Stocks
entry.summary: The $7.2 trillion asset manager now owns half a billion dollars worth of Riot Blockchain and Marathon Digital shares.

entry.title: Half a Billion Has Poured Into Bitcoin Funds in Past Three Weeks
entry.summary: But exchange inflows are at a cycle low, signaling that it's primarily institutions that feel bullish.

entry.title: 100 Thieves' Moe Says Blockchain Games Will 'Eventually' Be Accepted by Livestreamers
entry.summary: 100 Thieves content creator and gamer Moe also goes by "Yassuo" online after his favorite League of Legends character. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.

entry.title: Crypto Twitter Reacts to Arkham’s New 'Dox-to-Earn' Intelligence Exchange
entry.summary: Blockchain intelligence firm Arkham is opening an exchange where data on the identities of crypto wallet owners can be traded and requested.

entry.title: Gutter Cat Gang Twitter Hacked, At Least $750K Worth of NFTs Swiped
entry.summary: The Twitter account for the NFT project Gutter Cat Gang were hacked to promote a fake airdrop to an audience of more than 124,000 followers.

entry.title: Is Bitcoin an Investment or a Currency ?
entry.summary: Bitcoin is being explored as three distinct ideas: a currency, an asset and a commodity. Because regulation takes place mostly at state level, Bitcoin has become all three things simultaneously in different parts of the world.

entry.title: What is Hashing?
entry.summary: Hashing is one of the most crucial pieces of technology that keeps the Bitcoin network secure. But how does it work?

entry.title: Stepn Creator's Next Game Is a Social MMO Called Gas Hero
entry.summary: Gas Hero, from the developer of move-to-earn game Stepn, takes place in a dystopian world where a powerful AI has triggered nuclear war.

entry.title: "Games of the Future Are Going to Be Different," Says Splinterlands Cofounder
entry.summary: Splinterlands Cofounder Matt Rosen tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the game has evolved over its five-year history and why he doesn't listen to the FUD around crypto.

entry.title: Inside Champions Ascension: Like 'For Honor' with NFTs?
entry.summary: Plai Labs Marketing Director Payton Kaleiwahea tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about player response to the combat game Champions Ascension in development, which offers arena combat, raid bosses, AI landscape features, and more.

entry.title: Ex-Activision VP Michael Lee: Gaming Is Crypto's 'Killer App'
entry.summary: Former Activision Vice President Michael Lee is now the SVP of Growth at Matter Labs. At the 3XP gaming conference, Lee sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss crypto gaming and give his predictions for the industry.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes with AMGI Studios and My Pet Hooligan
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes to Burbank, California for a behind-the-scenes tour of AMGI Studios, the developers of upcoming game My Pet Hooligan.

entry.title: Why Legend of Arcardia Chose Sui Over EVM Chains
entry.summary: Legend of Arcadia Executive Producer Andy Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game and why they switched from EVM to new protocol Sui.

entry.title: Rumble Racing Star Game Preview: Is This Mario Kart With NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin shares a first look at Delabs' upcoming lawn mower racing game Rumble Racing Star, which offers a large cast of quirky characters pulled from the worlds of Bored Ape Yacht Club, Pudgy Penguins, and more.

entry.title: Why Laguna Games Turned Down 'Game of Thrones' for Crypto Unicorns
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Laguna Games about why the team chose to move away from an offer with WB Games to develop a Game of Thrones licensed title—and made Crypto Unicorns instead.

entry.title: Mythical Games CEO John Linden on NFL Rivals Topping 1M Downloads
entry.summary: Mythical Games just raised a $37 million Series C1 round on the back of the early success of NFL Rivals, which has already topped a million downloads in two months. Mythical CEO John Linden joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to discuss the launch and impact of NFL Rivals.

entry.title: How Ava Labs Is Approaching Gaming on Avalanche
entry.summary: At 3XP, Ava Labs Head of Gaming Ed Chang sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss some of the biggest Avalanche-based games on the horizon and how the company is approaching and thinking about Web3 gaming.

entry.title: Ogimi Founder David Gull on Why AI Should Be Your Meditation Coach
entry.summary: Ogimi founder David Gull speaks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson about its AI-driven meditation guides and how the technology can enable a more unique, custom-tailored meditation experience for users.

entry.title: VaynerSports Gaming VP Discusses Web3 Content Creators, Decentralized Streaming
entry.summary: Darren Glover, VP of Gaming at talent management agency VaynerSports, sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss the challenges faced by Web3-centric content creators, the current state of the esports market, and how decentralized streaming platforms can challenge centralized leaders like Twitch.

entry.title: NYXL Co-Founder on the State of Esports and Crypto Gaming
entry.summary: Rohit Gupta, co-founder of esports team NYXL, chats with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss challenges faced by the esports industry and opportunities and experiments in Web3.

entry.title: What Is GameBridge? Inside Shrapnel's Gaming Innovation
entry.summary: Marc Mercuri, Head of Platform for Web3 shooter Shrapnel, speaks with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo about GameBridge, a feature that simplifies blockchain item composability and interoperability.

entry.title: Gods Unchained Executive Producer Discusses Epic Games Store Move
entry.summary: Daniel Paez, Executive Producer on Immutable X-based card-battler Gods Unchained, discusses the long-running NFT game's launch on the Epic Games Store and the opportunity it provides.

entry.title: 'Play-to-Earn Is Not Dead. It Will Never Die' Says Words with Friends Creator Paul Bettner
entry.summary: Words With Friends and Wildcard Creator Paul Bettner tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his perspective on Axie Infinity and Web3 games.

entry.title: Cross the Ages Game Review: A Tough But Rewarding Card Battler
entry.summary: Cross the Ages is a digital collectible card game that challenges players to duel online opponents—and you can even mint your cards as tradable NFTs. It's complex and difficult to grasp at first, but this mobile-first game has some serious strategic upside. GG contributor Ryan Gladwin puts Cross the Ages through its paces.

entry.title: "AI Is Game-Changing But Needs Fact-Checking": AlchemyAI Project Lead
entry.summary: In this interview, Decrypt's Jason Nelson chats with Alchemy product manager and AlchemyAI project lead Elan Halpern on blockchain analysis using ChatGPT, what AI means for better user experience, and the need to fact-check AI. Halpern also gives a demo of the new AlchemyAI ChatGPT plugin.

entry.title: Fractal Is Like an Arcade, Says Twitch Co-Founder Justin Kan
entry.summary: Justin Kan was a co-founder of Twitch and now works on Fractal, a Web3 gaming startup. Kan tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his new company and what he's up to.
